description: Number of solutions to c(1)*prime(3)+...+c(n)*prime(n+2) = 1, where c(i) = +-1 for i>1, c(1) = 1.
links: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..500
mathematica: {f, s} = {3, 1}; Table[t = Map[Prime[# + f - 1] &, Range[2, z]]; Count[Map[Apply[Plus, #] &, Map[t # &, Tuples[{-1, 1}, Length[t]]]], s - Prime[f]], {z, 22}](* A022901, a(n) = number of solutions of "sum = s" using Prime(f) to Prime(f+n-1) *)n = 7; t = Map[Prime[# + f - 1] &, Range[n]]; Map[#[[2]] &, Select[Map[{Apply[Plus, #], #} &, Map[t # &, Map[Prepend[#, 1] &, Tuples[{-1, 1}, Length[t] - 1]]]], #[[1]] == s &]]  (* the 3 solutions of using n=7 primes; Peter Moses, Oct 01 2013 *)
